trans-unit.source: Where is Dharma Sangha now?
Is Dharma Sangha still not eating anything or just eating herbs from the jungle?
Why is he meditating? What does he want to achieve?
trans-unit.target: Por qué está meditando? Qué quiere lograr?

trans-unit.source: Is Dharma Sangha already enlightened?
trans-unit.target: Es Dharma Sangha ya un iluminado?

trans-unit.source: Has he already become a Buddha?
trans-unit.target: Se ha convertido en un Buda?

trans-unit.source: Is his teaching based on Buddhism or any other religions like Hinduism?
trans-unit.target: Sus enseñanzas se basan en el Budismo o en otras religiones como el Hinduísmo?

trans-unit.source: What does "Bodhi Shravan Dharma Sangha" mean?
How can I receive blessing from Dharma Sangha?
trans-unit.target: Cómo puede recibir la bendición de Dharma Sangha?

trans-unit.source: How to reach Ratanpur and Terthup?
What does Jyampa, Ginphen, Maitri, Maitreya and Metta mean?
I am going to Halkhoriya Jungle. What should I take with me? I also would like to bring some gifts, what is the best choice?
How can I get to Halkhoriya Jungle?
He is meditating in Halkhoriya Jungle, Bara District in Nepal.
trans-unit.target: El está en la selva de Halkhoriya, Nepal, meditanto y dictando su libro a Khenpo.

trans-unit.source: He is not eating anything.
Dharma Sangha wants to liberate the whole world by spreading Dharma and insight he’ve gained through his meditation.
trans-unit.target: Dharma Sangha quiere liberar al mundo entero al diseminar Dharma y el conocimiento que ha ganado a través de su meditación.

trans-unit.source: Yes, he is already enlightened. The first stages of enlightenment occurred in his room at home.
trans-unit.target: Sí, Palden Dorje ya es un iluminado.

trans-unit.source: Dharma Sangha can’t tell it now. Time will reveal.
trans-unit.target: Dharma Sangha no habla de eso ahora. El tiempo lo revelará.

trans-unit.source: It is actually called Bodhi Shravan Dharma Sangha, but it includes all religions, no one is excluded. Dharma Sangha will be moving forward by including all existing religions of the world.
trans-unit.target: En realidad se llama Bodhi Shravan Dharma Sangha, pero incluye a todas las religiones, nadie es excluido. Dharma Sangha procederá incluyendo a todas las religiones que existen en el mundo.

trans-unit.source: Bodhi: enlightenment, awakened.
Shravan: attending to, heeding, listening.
Dharma: wisdom.
Sangha: association, assembly, community.
Thus "Bodhi Shravan Dharma Sangha" is the wisdom as heeded from enlightened ones.
Please go to
Impractical gifts are not really good to bring (pictures, vases, etc). Below is a list of small practical things, which are needed regularly in the jungle:
Scissors.
Plastic buckets and boxes for storing food to keep it safe from monkey-robbers, etc.
Pens and copybooks.
CANDLES (not perfumed ones).
Sleeping bag, blankets, mat/mattress.
Flashlights (solar powered, if possible).
Sealed medicine with English leaflets (especially for colds, cough, wound disinfectants, bandages and first aid supplies).
Lighters.
100% natural material clothes or mats for sitting on the ground.
Soap, shampoo, laundry soap.
Mosquito nets and natural sprays.
Make sure that Dharma Sangha will accept visitors on the day you are going to the jungle (every Tuesday and Saturday from 11 am to 1 pm for now) by checking updates on website and forum

Keep in mind that it is not allowed to stay in Halkhoriya overnight and it is not advised to walk in jungle after 5pm, because wild animals are very active in the evening. So you should plan to reach in the jungle early in the morning and leave before 5 pm.
Come to Kathmandu (if you are not coming from India, or Bhutan, or China.)
Make arrangements with Committee (contact details will be available later).

From Kathmandu you can take a jeep "Tata Sumo" (name of popular jeep in the area) in Bolkhu place. The journey by the jeep is a 4-hour drive from Kathmandu to Simara. The other alternative is travelling by bus up to Simara which is 10-11 hour drive at night.

From Simara you should get to Pilua Junction or Pasaha Bridge (Pilua village bus stop). You can take the 20 minute bus ride or take a "Tata Sumo" (contact Lama Hotel, owned by Krishna meme, pronounced meh-meh meaning “respected grandfather”, though one need not be as old as a grandfather to earn this title).
From Pasaha Bridge to Halkhoriya Jungle (about 6-7 km) you can take a tractor which belongs to Committee. The road is a dry river bed and it is rough and bumpy ride.
Gompa, Ratanpur
Jyampa, Ginphen, Maitri, Maitreya and Metta mean "loving kindness".
